Comments_List: The course offered a rich collection of environmental literature, constructing a cultural foundation for contemporary debates about climate change.
I learned about 19th century American environmental literature.
The readings were all very interesting but sometimes a bit long.
The course provides a rich historical contextualization; however, the syllabus would benefit from more contemporary works.

This class includes a really interesting and novel mix of environmental literature and topics that don't necessarily fit the generic sublime image of that some authors were trying to create. However, the discussion environment was not totally comfortable.
I would recommend this course to anyone who seeks an English/AMST approach to American environmental history.

I would recommend this class to another student because of the variety of authors that they would be exposed to and the ways in which their thinking would be changed or clarified if they are interested in environmental literature, as well as general skills picked up from taking an English class.
